name: Establishment Hotel

reviews.text: i'm definitely more likely to book a stay with a boutique hotel vs a major chain. i found the establishment hotel one of the better boutiques i've stayed in. i stayed for 2 nights (thursday and friday) by myself (woman in my early 30s) and then moved to another hotel, blue, for 2 other nights, only because i extended my trip and when i did so, the establishment hotel was already overbooked. here are the pros/cons of the hotel, from my experience:
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations
The Establishment Hotel is worth finding

reviews.text: 1. location. the location, which i was somewhat skeptical about, was actually quite convenient and very short and safe walking distance to all the tourist haunts (opera house, harbour bridge, circular quay, shopping, chinatown, botanical gardens) in sydney.
reviews.title: Boutique (even with Baby)

reviews.text: 2. rooms. the rooms were surprisingly and pleasantly large, with very nice layout. i stayed on the 3rd floor. the room was large with beautiful wide, dark wood flooring. the bed (i'm assuming it was a queen) was on a platform against one wall. a living area and desk area were also part of the spacious room. the hallway leading to the bathroom was all closets. the bathroom was interesting. split tub and shower, double sinks, and toilet separate as well. the tub had a partition that would either join the bathroom to the rest of the space/living area/bedroom or could be closed to make the bathroom truly a separate space. since i was traveling alone, i left that partition open the entire time, which made the room seem even larger. the phone next to the bed had all sorts of controls on them to change the lighting set-up, room temperature, direct dial to hot sydney restaurants, and all the other good stuff.
reviews.title: a nice alternative that beats the 5-stars in CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. value. the establishment is a bit pricey for most people, granted. but if you're able and willing to spend around $320 AUS for a room, then this is your place. this included a decently sized room -- maybe twice or more the size of a room in any of the nyc boutique hotels like the hudson, chambers, etc. that also included breakfast, which i only discovered the day i left unfortunately, from anything, it seemed, from their breakfast menu, plus free wired high speed internet in the rooms. they also had a small exercise room with towels and water too. comparing that to the $290 AUS i paid to stay at blue hotel (with $25 AUS for internet access for a 24 hour period and no breakfast), i found the establishment to be a better overall deal and value.
reviews.title: superb place

reviews.text: We arrived early in the monring after a very long flight, and we loved the room.
reviews.title: Great room, bad service, and so much noise..

reviews.text: It was lovely, spacious and great design. However once we went to bed, there was
reviews.title: Awesome, indeed.

likes.liked: — The architecture, and the classy layout (carpet, furniture, etc)
likes.disliked: — The complication of security.. you need your card for everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: so much noise, it felt like our bed was standing in the middle of a very busy
reviews.title: Chic, boutique hotel..great stay
Perfect in almost every way
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something boutique with great service. We will be going back.

reviews.title: Great personal hotel
reviews.text: I've just left the Establishment, having stayed there for 11 nights for business.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the hotel great and by the end of my stay was really sad to leave!
reviews.title: not great....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel that is part of a sort of complex (I use this word loosely), of bars, restaurants, night club - all of which you can indulge in or not - your decision and the hotel is kept seperate from the facilities.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in downtown Sydney
Loved this hotel
reviews.text: Room: I stayed in room 54 and it was great, plenty of space, good facilities, great bed and internet access was free of charge.Turn down service was very thorough and the cookies each evening are dangerous for the waist line!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Towels and linen were devine, one thing I dislike is hotels that use bad versions of these, and it certainly didn't feel like the case here.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Establishment from Christmas Eve for 4 nights with my wife. This boutique hotel is fantastic. There is a definite "cool" vibe and the staff are very friendly and helpful (not snobby at all). If you are looking for a quieter room, simply ask to stay away from the club or go during the week. I would definitely recommend this hotel and rank it up there with other great boutique hotels that I've stayed at such as the Soho Grand in New York, and Opus in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Fantastic Boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Wicked, cool & funky

likes.disliked: — Mini bar could be more exciting.

description: A luxurious boutique hotel, with a uniquely intimate feel.31 elegantly appointed guest rooms, including two stylish Penthouse suites, access to a private gym and Establishment’s numerous bars and restaurants. Establishment hotel offers world class accommodation for discerning travellers. Located in the middle of Sydney’s CBD, it’s a very short walk to Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and botanical gardens.Voted Best Boutique Hotel Accommodation in Australia by the National Australia Hotel Association in 2006.
